content.question: Two groups of students use the circuit shown above to measure the potential difference across and current through the same lightbulb. The results of the two groupsâ€™ measurements are shown in the graphs. What can the students correctly conclude about the ohmic behavior of the lightbulb?

choices.label: Both groups can conclude that the lightbulb is ohmic.
Group 2 can conclude that the lightbulb is always ohmic, but group 1 cannot.
Group 2 can conclude that the lightbulb shows ohmic behavior within the range of values measured. Group 1 can conclude that the lightbulb is not ohmic.
Neither group can make any claims about the ohmic behavior of the lightbulb.

content.answer: Group 2 can conclude that the lightbulb shows ohmic behavior within the range of values measured. Group 1 can conclude that the lightbulb is not ohmic.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
